result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Scott Meteraud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Scott Meteraud

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:46 AM Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Eric Scott Meteraud. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Count 1 as a repeater. Count 2 to be dismissed but read in. For Count 1, 6 years prison fashioned as 4 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent with any other sentence. Credit of 114 days. Conditions include pay restitution in the amount of $220.00, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay mandatory court costs. Defendant would be eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse programming. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Attorney Craker stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Court imposes for Count 1, 6 years prison fashioned as 4 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent with any other sentence. Credit of 114 days credit. Conditions include pay restitution in the amount of $220.00, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, pay mandatory court costs and pay any remaining court costs. Count 2 is dismissed but read in.

9:20 AM Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker appeared by phone for Eric Scott Meteraud.  Court calls case. Attorney asks for plea.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Eric Scott Meteraud. 
Att Craker- requests hearing in May
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:31 AM Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Craker received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Requests status conference. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to Judge Glonek from defendant re: charges and asking for mercy of the Court

records.addlTxt:
01:30 PM Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Eric Scott Meteraud in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Scott Meteraud appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty Craker questions defendant if there is an alternate address. Defendant offers alternate address.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  States request on bail: $750 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victim1 & 2. State receites prior criminal history with 2 F.T.A.'s with cash bail and never posted.  Atty Craker indicates Defendant has lived in Douglas county all of his life. Has strong family ties to the area. Defendant does not have any money to post. Atty Craker aruges cash bail. Defendant did make all his appearances on signature bond. 
Court has concerns with felonies and f.t.a.'s. Court will order $1000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victims 1 & 2 or the address as listed in the ID Key.
Defendant does qualify for Public Defendar. Court will send Text Message reminder slip to the Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key
